thread.title: Cleveland Cavaliers set another record for 3-pointers against Atlanta Hawks
thread.title_full: Cleveland Cavaliers set another record for 3-pointers against Atlanta Hawks

title: Cleveland Cavaliers set another record for 3-pointers against Atlanta Hawks
text:
Mar 3, 2017 at 10:01p ET 0Shares 
The Cleveland Cavaliers set another record for 3-pointers against the Atlanta Hawks on Friday night. 
The Cavs made 25 in a 135-130 win, matching the NBA record they set last year against the Hawks in the playoffs, and setting a new NBA record for the regular season. 
Last year they did it in Cleveland, and Friday night they shot out the lights in Atlanta, with six Cavs hitting three triples or more. Richard Jefferson set a team record with this trey: 2⃣3⃣ THREES! 
— Cleveland Cavaliers (@cavs) March 4, 2017 
Then LeBron James tied the NBA regular-season record: 2️⃣4️⃣ @KingJames triple ties the NBA regular season record for threes in a game! #CavsHawks #DefendTheLand pic.twitter.com/d2Z4c0DMQM 
— Cleveland Cavaliers (@cavs) March 4, 2017 
And it was only right that Kyle Korver capped it, delivering a dagger in his return to Atlanta: 2️⃣5️⃣ THREES! 
We just set the @NBA All-Time record for threes in a regular season game with 25! pic.twitter.com/dmGE4aRHRt 
— Cleveland Cavaliers (@cavs) March 4, 2017 
Cleveland made 25 of 46 threes to break a record that stood less than three months. Houston made 24 treys in a 122-100 win over New Orleans on Dec. 16. Kyrie Irving scored 43 points, LeBron James had 38. 
The Associated Press contributed to this report.
